content.description: Samples G and H were selected from the same population of quantitative data and the mean of each sample was determined. The mean of sample G is equal to the mean of the population.
content.question: Which of the following statements must be true?The mean of sample H must also be equal to the population mean.The mean of sample G, <math alttext="x bar sub G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">G</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, is a point estimator for the mean of the population.The mean of sample H, <math alttext="x bar sub H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, is a point estimator for the mean of the population.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
